meanings.definition: A person who believes in the concept of dualism.
meanings.sent1: The dualist thought that good and evil were separate forces in the world.
meanings.sent2: She was known as a dualist because she believed in the existence of both body and soul.
meanings.sent3: The dualist chuckled at the idea of a talking cat and dog debating philosophy.
meanings.sent4: His mind worked like a dualist, always analyzing situations from two opposing viewpoints.
meanings.sent5: The image of the dualist juggling two different colored balls symbolized his belief in the duality of existence.

meanings.definition: Relating to or based on the idea of dualism.
meanings.sent1: The painting showcased a dualist theme with contrasting colors and shapes.
meanings.sent2: Her dualist perspective allowed her to see the world in shades of black and white.
meanings.sent3: The dualist design of the room featured two distinct styles blended together seamlessly.
meanings.sent4: The dualist nature of the debate highlighted the opposing viewpoints of the participants.
meanings.sent5: The dualist approach to problem-solving involved considering both sides before making a decision.
